;Recently, a screenshot of a research report comparing BYD’s U8 and T-90 main battle tanks was exposed. This screenshot of the research report comes from the special research report on BYD released by the Western Securities R&D Center on October 24, 2023: "BYD (002594.SZ) first coverage report: Cost is the shield, technology is the spear, and the sword points at the global automotive leader" .

;

;On page 26 of the research report, in order to present the output power of BYD's Yi Sifang four-wheel motor, Western Securities compared the output power, engine, and body of BYD's U8 and T-90 main battle tanks. , amphibious, on-site U-turn, lateral travel, zero-hundred acceleration and the number of driving wheels, and concluded: "The technical indicators of Yi Sifang's four-wheel motor are comprehensively leading the industry." Looking up at the amphibious and lateral travel functions of U8, T -90 tanks are "none".

;

;According to Blue Whale Finance, a relevant person from Western Securities responded that the report was not written by an intern, and that the comparison of BYD’s U8 with main battle tanks was affected by relevant publicity.

;

;What is the impact of relevant publicity? Previously, many self-media compared BYD’s U8 with tanks. Regardless of whether the research report of Western Securities was influenced by self-media, but comparing electric vehicles with main battle tanks, and then claiming that its technical indicators are comprehensively leading the industry, whether the relevant arguments and conclusions are rigorous and reasonable will naturally be questioned by investors and public opinion. .

;

;In addition, in June this year, Western Securities and analysts were punished for research reports. According to the warning letter from the Shaanxi Supervision Bureau of the China Securities Regulatory Commission: After investigation, the internal control mechanism for the securities research report publishing business of Western Securities is not sound, individual surveys did not fulfill the pre-approval procedures, sales staff participated in the assessment of research report analysts, and compliance management did not cover expert consulting services. The main business links; the quality control and review of research reports are not strict, and some research reports have unreasonable valuation forecasts and imprudent conclusions.

;

;The relevant securities research report produced by Luo Yamein, the signed analyst of BYD’s research report, has problems such as imprudent research methods, lack of reasonable justification for some assumptions, and insufficient basis for some conclusions. Not only was it shown The warning letter is also recorded in the securities and futures market integrity files.

;

;Less than half a year later, Western Securities and the same analyst released another controversial research report.

;

;Of course, this was not done by a securities firm called Western Securities. In recent years, there have been numerous cases of securities companies being fined for "weird research reports". On December 30, 2021, the Jiangxi Securities Regulatory Bureau issued two law enforcement documents, punishing Guosheng Securities and its researchers for their conduct related to the research report "A Preliminary Study on the Application of Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches in Timing". On October 18 of that year, a report titled "A Preliminary Study on the Application of Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches in Timing" by Guosheng Securities attracted public attention. In the report, it is explained in detail how the "Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches" dominate the market's time cycle, and how to apply the "Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches" in timing. Liu Fubing, who issued this research report, has been in the industry for more than 12 years and has been listed as the best analyst of New Fortune 8 times, including No. 1 6 times.

;

;If we say that the above-mentioned research report is "even if it is not shocking, it will never stop", so it has become a talking point for people. There is also a type of "weird research reports" that are more likely to mislead investors.

;

;In July 2020, the Jiangsu Securities Regulatory Bureau posted an administrative penalty decision against two analysts Ma Haobo who signed the research report "Fucheng In-depth Report 2: Three 10 billion to support doubling of market value" , Tang Weiliang were fined a total of 200,000 yuan.

;

;In 2016, a research report released by Soochow Securities boldly predicted that Fucheng Shares (600965.SH), "the number one A-share funeral stock", would be the absolute leader in the funeral industry in the future. And gave Fucheng shares a "buy" rating.

;

;However, on October 25 of that year, Fucheng Shares issued a "clarification announcement" to clarify the relevant contents of the research report. Soochow Securities' "Fucheng Research Report" stated that the number of tombs after the completion of the third phase of Fucheng's pagoda cemetery will reach 400,000. Based on this data, it was concluded that Fucheng's net profit would be 15.5 billion yuan. After investigation, Fucheng Co., Ltd.'s pagoda cemetery plans to build about 125,000 tombs. "Fucheng Research Report" also stated that the industrial merger and acquisition fund jointly established by Fucheng Co., Ltd. and an investment company has a total scale of 10 billion yuan. The current scale is 1 billion yuan, and the follow-up fund scale will be 9 billion yuan. After investigation, as of October 2016, the size of the above-mentioned M&A fund was only 1 billion yuan. The status of subsequent funds will need to be made by Fucheng Shares based on the progress of the first-phase fund and the quality of the assets acquired. Third, "Fucheng Research Report" stated that the company's major shareholders have 10 billion in cash and have sufficient funds to serve as the backend of the above-mentioned merger and acquisition funds. After investigation, as of October 2016, the major shareholders had not made a decision in this regard.

;

;The relevant quoted data in the research report released by Soochow Securities is far from the actual data of Fucheng Shares. I am afraid that the source of the information and whether the data has been investigated and verified are all a mess. How can a research report like this deserve market credibility?

;

;The so-called research reports are analysis reports prepared by financial institutions such as securities companies, fund companies, banks, etc. They mainly include company analysis reports, industry analysis reports, investment strategy reports, etc. The purpose of the research report is to help investors better understand the market, the company, and the industry so that they can be used as a reference when investing. However, the content is full of errors and omissions, pointing the research direction towards Feng Shui, or making gimmicks of comparing electric vehicles with main battle tanks, which reflects that some brokers do not pay attention to the professionalism of the research report, and even use the research report as a tool for speculation.

;

;The motivation behind securities firms’ “weird research reports” cannot simply be attributed to sensationalism. In financial markets, information release is a form of power to some extent. Therefore, regulatory authorities have corresponding standards for financial institutions, listed companies, and media to release various types of investment-oriented information. As professional information providers, brokerage research reports influence investors' decisions to a considerable extent. However, in the process of pursuing so-called market influence, some securities companies make some shocking remarks to attract attention and attention. There will be traffic or profit considerations, and they may even interfere or distort market trends. Since brokerages are also one of the important stock holders in the stock market, if a brokerage publishes a research report that is "bullish" or "short" on a listed company or a certain sector in an exaggerated way, and secretly buys or sells the corresponding stocks, wouldn't it be typical? Manipulation of the stock market?

;

;In this regard, regulatory authorities have also promulgated relevant new management policies many times in recent years. In May last year, the regulatory authorities sent the "Notice on the "Double Random" On-site Inspection of the Securities Research Report Business to all securities firms. The report shows that in 2022, a special "double random" on-site inspection of research and reporting business will be carried out in the entire industry, covering a total of 45 securities companies and 300 research reports. In September of that year, the China Securities Association reiterated the self-regulatory management of the securities research business of securities firms, including that holdings of more than 1% of the research target stocks must be disclosed and that reverse operations are not allowed within two trading days of the release of the research report; however, various management measures do not seem to hinder The continuation of "Weird Research Reports".

;

;This shows that for strange research reports, the regulatory authorities’ punishment and supervision need to be strengthened. Warning letters, inclusion in integrity files, etc. cannot touch the core interests of relevant personnel and securities companies, so that they would rather have short-term market effects than adhere to compliance. Only by clarifying the responsibilities of securities firms in the production and release of research reports and continuing to increase penalties for violations can the regulatory authorities stop the vicious cycle of "bad coins eliminating good coins" in securities firms' research reports.

;

;

;This round of transfers in Hengyang is considered the "first sale" of government data and has attracted widespread attention. Visual China/Picture

;

;On November 15, 2023, the Hengyang Municipal Public Resources Trading Center issued a notice stating that according to the request from the transferor Hengyang Municipal Administrative Approval Service Bureau, the "Hengyang Municipal Government Data Resources and Intelligence" is now suspended. "Urban franchise rights transfer project" transaction activities.

;

;Five days ago, the official website of Hengyang Public Resources Trading Center announced that it would sell Hengyang municipal government data resources and smart city franchise rights through online bidding, with a starting price of 1.8 billion yuan.

;

;Nowhere has previously auctioned and transferred government data resources in the form of a franchise. Therefore, this round of transfer is considered the "first auction" of government data and has attracted widespread attention.

;

;“After receiving a letter from the Hengyang Administrative Approval Service Bureau, the transaction was suspended, but the letter did not explain the specific reasons.” A staff member of the Hengyang Public Resources Trading Center told Southern Weekend reporters that there had been The company called to inquire about the project.

;

;Two staff members of the Hengyang Municipal Administrative Approval Service Bureau confirmed to Southern Weekend reporters that the above-mentioned franchise transfer project was suspended because they received notification from the superior department.

;

; "The state is coordinating this (public data) work, and they will give some guidance before proceeding." A staff member of the Hengyang Municipal Administrative Approval Service Bureau told Southern Weekend reporters that the project is on hold. , the plan still needs to be improved.

;

;Does not involve national security, business secrets or personal privacy

;

;According to the official website of Hengyang Public Resources Trading Center, the transfer was approved by the Hengyang Municipal Government, and the subject matter is divided into two parts: government affairs data resources and smart cities.

;

;In December 2021, Hengyang, Hunan Province issued the "Hengyang Municipal Government Data Sharing and Open Management Measures" (hereinafter referred to as the Management Measures).

;

;The management measures clearly state that government data refers to various types of information such as documents, materials, charts, pictures, videos and data produced or obtained by government departments in the course of performing their duties and recorded and saved in a certain form. Resources include information resources collected by various government departments directly or through third parties in accordance with the law, authorized and managed in accordance with the law, and information resources formed by relying on the government information system to perform their duties.

;

;"Encourage the open utilization of information under the conditions of ensuring data security, personal privacy and corporate commercial confidentiality." The management measures state that it is necessary to promote the registration and confirmation of open data, value assessment and other work, and actively explore the data market operations.

;

;The management measures state that public data that involves national security, business secrets and personal privacy, or that is not allowed to be opened in accordance with laws, regulations and other regulations, are parts that are not allowed to be opened. Any leakage of state secrets, work secrets, business secrets and personal privacy will be dealt with in accordance with the National Secrets Law and relevant regulations.

;

;In June 2023, Guizhou issued a document requiring that big data authorities at all levels authorize qualified market entities to operate government data at the same level and develop data that does not involve state secrets, commercial secrets, or personal privacy. Data services and products and trade through Guiyang Big Data Exchange.

;

;The above-mentioned management measures of Hengyang state that the data rights belong to the government, and Hengyang Development Investment Group Co., Ltd. is authorized to develop and operate it through a franchise. According to the Enterprise Alert, the company is the largest urban investment platform in Hengyang, with assets exceeding 140 billion yuan, and is 100% owned by the Hengyang Municipal State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission.

;

;However, the Hengyang Municipal Party Committee and Municipal Government believe that the government data operation effect of Hengyang Development Investment Group needs to be improved.

;

;On July 27, 2023, the official website of the Hengyang Municipal Commission for Discipline Inspection and Supervision released the "Notice on the Progress of Inspection and Rectification by the Committee of the Communist Party of China Hengyang Development Investment Group Co., Ltd."

;

;The second issue reported is "Ineffective implementation of the decisions and arrangements of the municipal party committee and municipal government." In this regard, the rectification situation reads, "Accelerate the injection of some asset resources that have been expressly determined by the municipal party committee and government... Actively strive to complete the joint review of the implementation plan of government data resources (including Hengyang Mass App) and smart city franchise rights.";

;What content is involved in smart cities is not mentioned on the official website of Hengyang Public Resources Trading Center and the transaction attachments.

;

;The pricing method for public data is not yet clear

;

;On the official website of Hengyang Public Resource Trading Center, the transfer of government data resources will adopt a bidding method, with a starting price of 1.8 billion yuan, each time The price increase is 10 million yuan. It is disclosed in the transaction attachment that the starting price is the appraisal price of the target, but the columns for the appraisal agency and the appraisal base date are both blank.

;

;Why did the project evaluation price reach 1.8 billion yuan? Staff from the Hengyang Administrative Approval Service Bureau did not respond.

;

;Currently, the pricing of data resources is an industry problem. In February 2023, Zhao Jingwu, associate professor at Beihang University School of Law, wrote an article stating that data valuation indicators are not unified and data quality standards are difficult to determine.

;

;He believes that even in general data trading activities, the so-called market pricing is just the result of self-negotiation between the parties to the transaction. This "one thing, one discussion" data valuation model is difficult to achieve for digital purposes. The market provides sufficient reference basis.

;

;Government data faces the same problem. On November 16, at the main forum of the 2023 China Data Element Industry Innovation Conference, Wang Jiandong, deputy director of the Price Monitoring Center of the National Development and Reform Commission, said, “Before the end of this year or early next year, management measures for government-guided pricing of public data may be introduced. ”

;

;The official website of Hengyang Public Resources Trading Center shows that the return mechanism of the government data resource franchise project is “user pays”. During the franchise period, the franchisee can charge fees from users within the scope of the franchise in return for project construction. However, the official website did not announce the specific number of years.

;

;One interviewee’s company is responsible for building a government data platform for a southern province. He explained to Southern Weekend reporters that users who will pay mainly refer to enterprises in various places that have information business needs, rather than individuals.

;

;Prior to this, Hangzhou, Qingdao and other places have also tried to authorize operations for public data.

;

;In September 2023, Hangzhou released the "Public Data Authorized Operation Implementation Plan (Trial)". The document states that the next step is to determine the operating entity of the authorized operation platform, and with the consent of the municipal government, will be specifically responsible for the construction and operation, data management, operation and maintenance, and security of the authorized operation platform.

;

;Hangzhou’s plan states that priority will be given to supporting the development of public data authorization operations in the fields of credit, transportation, medical care, health, employment, social security, education, technology, finance, enterprise registration and supervision, housing construction, provident funds, and public security. , led by the competent departments in the field. Public data that is prohibited from being opened shall not be authorized for operation.

;

;;Doctoral profile: ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin, the first litigation jurist in New China PhD. ;

;

;;1953 Born in Taixing, Jiangsu Province in October. ;

;

;;1960 -1965, Jinjiang Primary School, Taixing Town, Taixing County, Jiangsu Province. ;

;

;;1965 -1971, junior high school and high school department of Taixing Middle School in Jiangsu Province. ;

;

;;1972 -In 1979, a worker at the commercial refrigerated ship repair and manufacturing plant in Jiangsu Province. ;

;

;;1979 From September to July 1983, he was an undergraduate student in the Law Department of China University of Political Science and Law. ;

;

;;September 1983-July 1986 In September, he graduated from the Graduate School of China University of Political Science and Law, majoring in criminal procedure law, and received a master's degree. ;

;

;;In August 1986, he stayed at the school and served as a full-time researcher at the China Legal Research Institute. ;

;

;;In September 1987, he studied for an on-the-job doctoral degree in litigation law at the Graduate School of China University of Political Science and Law; ;

;

;;In July 1991, he was awarded a doctorate in litigation law, becoming the country's first doctorate in litigation law. Professional doctorate;;

;

;;Associate professor in 1992 and professor in July 1997;;

;

;;In May 2000, he served as a doctoral supervisor in criminal procedure law;;

;

;;Served as deputy director of the China Legal Research Institute of China University of Political Science and Law in 1991 and director in 1995;;;

;;From 2001 to 2006, he served as Executive Vice Dean of the Graduate School of China University of Political Science and Law;;

;

;;August 1993-August 1994, served as a visiting scholar at New York University School of Law;;< /p>;

;;August 1999-August 2000, served as a senior visiting scholar at Harvard Law School and Yale Law School Scholar;;

;

;;From 2006 to 2022, he served as the Chairman of the Criminal Procedure Law Research Association of the China Law Society Chairman, President of China Criminal Procedure Law Research Association;;

;

;;2006-2019, served as Dean of the Institute of Litigation Law, China University of Political Science and Law;;

;

;;2003 to 2013, served as the State Council Member of the fourth and fifth legal discipline evaluation groups of the Academic Degree Committee. ;

;

;;

;

;Bian Jianlin, the first doctor of litigation law in New China. (Photo courtesy of interviewee)

;

;Enrolled into university at the age of 26 and graduated with a doctorate at the age of 38. This year, Bian Jianlin turns 70.

;

;At two o'clock in the afternoon on October 18, 2023, Bian Jianlin appeared at the door of the office of China University of Political Science and Law on time. He was tall and thin, wearing a fitted black casual suit and a trousers. He was wearing trousers and holding a red paper bag in his hand, which contained three volumes of "Governing the Country by Law and Criminal Procedure - Collected Works of Bian Jianlin's Legal Studies". For his 70th birthday this month, the publisher specially planned this collection of essays.

;

;In 1979, eight years after graduating from high school, Bian Jianlin left his hometown in Jiangsu and entered Beijing Political Science and Law School, which had just resumed school after the Cultural Revolution. College, which is now China University of Political Science and Law. Relying on employee scholarships provided by the state, Bian Jianlin completed his bachelor's and master's degrees. Just before life was about to reach another fork in the road, "a major event happened." In 1986, the third batch of law doctoral programs in the country was confirmed, and two law professors from China University of Political Science and Law were appointed as doctoral supervisors.

;

;In 1987, Bian Jianlin studied under Professor Chen Guangzhong, who is recognized as the "founder of criminal procedure law" in China. Four years later, he became the first doctoral student in criminal procedural law independently trained by the People's Republic of China, and embarked on a career development path similar to that of his mentor. To date, Bian Jianlin has trained 87 doctors and 11 postdoctoral fellows. He also serves as the honorary dean of the Procedural Law Institute of China University of Political Science and Law, the executive director and academic committee member of the China Law Society, and the honorary president of the China Criminal Procedural Law Research Association. He works as a professor at Jilin University, Wuhan University, Zhongnan University of Economics and Law, East China University of Political Science and Law, Northwest University of Political Science and Law, People's Public Security University of China, and National Prosecutor's College. On social media, he always actively participates in various seminars and academic lectures to share his understanding and suggestions on the construction of the criminal procedure system.

;

;Unwilling to flaunt himself, Bian Jianlin almost never talks about his past experiences in public. Even in this two-hour interview, the topic never got around to his mentor. And he himself seemed to be just an ordinary student who was "older and started school late", and he was lucky enough to get to where he is now by accident.

;

;;Accidentally became the "first";

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In the preface of the anthology, it seems that this is the first time you mentioned your experiences as a student. ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;I don’t like to talk about my resume. This collection of essays has a profound impact on my academic work. It means life summary, so I said a few words in the preface. I was admitted early at the University of Political Science and Law, and was in the first class after the school was re-established. However, compared with other scholars who entered earlier, I was still relatively older when I entered. Fortunately, I completed my bachelor's degree, master's degree and Ph.D. in one go, so I gained some time back. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; What were you doing before you were admitted to the Beijing University of Political Science and Law in 1979? How did you think of studying law? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;After graduating from high school in 1971, I went to work in a provincial factory. Later, the college entrance examination was resumed, but after all, it was not a required option. Very few of my high school classmates went on to college. At that time, everyone had a job and even got married and had children. But I still have a little bit of ambition, and I have such an ambition to take the exam. As for studying law, it is almost an inevitable choice. First of all, during the ten years of turmoil, our generation was wasted. Basically, we did not learn mathematics, physics and chemistry, and we were seriously partial to subjects. It was not easy to take the science and engineering exams, so we had to choose from liberal arts. Foreign languages, Chinese, history and law, among which law is definitely the most attractive. The main reason is that many of the books I read in the past were about solving crimes, about identifying doubts and clearing grievances, punishing evil and eradicating evil, and upholding justice, so I naturally developed a legal feeling. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; Why study Criminal Procedure Law? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;When I was an undergraduate, the school had only one law major, and there was no further subdivision. major. When I was about to graduate, I decided to take the postgraduate entrance examination. According to my personality and interests, I didn’t really like civil law. What I liked most was the “study of criminal justice”, so my major choice should be criminal law. However, there is a certain degree of chance in choosing criminal procedure law. The school's master's entrance exams for Criminal Procedure Law and Criminal Law only differed in one subject, Criminal Procedure Archeology Chinese, while Criminal Law was the history of the legal system. In the year of the postgraduate entrance examination, I went home to celebrate the Spring Festival. After the Spring Festival, I had to take the exam. I thought that I would have to work hard to prepare for the legal history course, and there is always some basic knowledge in ancient Chinese, so it was just a matter of thought. The choice of exam subjects suddenly determined the direction of my major, so it was not that I realized the procedure from that time on. value and importance, because in fact substantive law was still ranked ahead of procedural law at that time. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; Law is a practical subject. During your studies, didn’t you ever think about getting into practice? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;To learn the law, you must use it. Logically speaking, you have to work in the practical department , plus I was relatively old when I entered school. At that time, a bachelor's degree was enough, and I also studied for a master's degree. So I faced two choices at the time. One was to follow my family's wishes and return to Jiangsu. The Provincial High School wanted to recruit a Mature judges are more interested in me; if they stay in Beijing, they want to go to the Interpol China National Central Bureau through an old leader of the Ministry of Public Security. I did have some thoughts, but in the end both options were given up, and they were not implemented to the extent of signing a contract. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; Why gave up? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;In 1986, before I graduated with my master’s degree, the school was approved for two doctoral programs, including Two teachers were identified as doctoral supervisors, namely Professor Wang Xuan and Professor Chen Guangzhong. Teacher Chen is responsible for the litigation law major. They are also the first batch of doctoral supervisors at China University of Political Science and Law. After receiving the PhD approval, Teacher Chen once talked to me. First, he told me that I had the opportunity to continue my studies; second, he expressed his affirmation to me. After Teacher Chen chatted with me, I was more tempted, although I didn’t fully appreciate the school’s advantages at the time. The most important thing is that my nature is that I am always uneasy about the status quo and have an upward spirit. I have never thought of being rich and settling down. In this way, I decided to continue studying for a Ph.D. after graduating with a master’s degree. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; You obtained your master's degree in 1986 and your doctoral program was approved in the same year. How come it was only a year later that you started studying for your Ph.D.? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;I started preparing for the Ph.D. exam before and after I graduated with my master’s degree. However, although the doctoral program was approved at that time, there were insufficient preparations for public announcements and enrollment listings. Due to various reasons, neither doctoral program enrolled students that year. However, Teacher Chen happened to be the deputy dean of the Graduate School at the time, and the school established a new research institution, the Chinese Legal Research Institute, with Teacher Chen also serving as the director. So I stayed in school and worked at the China Legal Research Institute, doing full-time research, doing projects, and writing articles. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; How many doctoral students studied with you under Professor Chen? Why were you the first doctoral student to graduate? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;Frankly speaking, in the first year of enrollment, the instructor has candidates in mind , but you still have to follow the formal process when applying. At that time, unlike now, the papers were basically judged on the spot after the exam, and the results were known quickly. Finally, Teacher Chen recruited me, and also recruited someone from our school. He was a master's student in criminal law in 1984, just one class after me. ;

;

;Speaking of this, it is also a coincidence. If the school had recruited doctors in 1986, he had not graduated with a master's degree at that time, and we would not be classmates. . However, although we are both in the first batch of doctoral students, he is a full-time student, while I am a part-time PhD student because I have already stayed in school to work. According to the country's degree regulations at that time, those studying for a PhD on the job would have to study longer than those studying full-time. As for how long, there is no clear regulation. So I extended my studies by one year and graduated in 4 years. If calculated according to this time, it is possible that he graduated before me, then I will not become the first doctorate in criminal procedural law.

;

;But the students in the same class later went to study in the United States and never came back, leaving me alone to hold on. Later, I joked that if he didn't leave, he would definitely graduate before me, and the title of the first doctor of litigation law would belong to him.

;

;;"Follow the teacher's steps";

;

;;Southern Weekends:;;The first batch of 18 Ph.D.s was produced in 1983, but the first recipient of a doctorate in law was graduated in 1987. Among all disciplines, law is not a niche, and it is not too early to cultivate a doctorate in law. What do you think?;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;I think the reason for getting a doctorate in law is a little later. First, the doctoral program was of high value at that time. At that time, the approval of the doctoral program and the determination of the doctoral supervisor required the approval of the Academic Degrees Committee of the State Council, which was very strictly controlled. The second reason is that from the perspective of faculty and research level, law was still a discipline with relatively scarce talents and did not have the conditions to train doctoral students. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; In 1988, Professor Chen Guangzhong edited the book "Comparative Research on Foreign Criminal Proceedings". Three years later, your doctoral thesis "Comparative Research on Criminal Prosecution Systems" was approved. From a professional research perspective, did Professor Chen have a great influence on you? big? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;Teacher Chen has always attached great importance to understanding and learning from foreign litigation systems. When we were still studying for master's degrees, there was a very lack of teaching materials. Basically, each school compiled and printed its own teaching materials. It happened that when Mr. Chen was the deputy dean of graduate students, he brought a topic from the Institute of Law of the Academy of Social Sciences on foreign criminal litigation. A comparative study of procedures. At that time, reform and opening up had already begun, and we were encouraged to study China's issues from a global perspective. Based on a group of experts from the Law Institute, Teacher Chen recruited some scholars from our school and other schools who studied this field to work together on this work. . Several of our classmates who are still studying for master's degrees also participated in part of it. I participated in writing a chapter, that is, compulsory medical measures, but I did not sign my name separately. I completed it under the guidance of my supervisor. ;

;

;At that time, this book was the first domestic comparative and systematic study of foreign criminal procedure. It was both authoritative and precious. If you want to know more about it, If you know something about it abroad, you must read this book. For those of us who participated in writing this book, because writing required research on foreign materials, only the University of Political Science and Law had this condition at the time, so it was the first step for me to broaden my academic horizons.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In the previous In an article, you called Professor Chen "the leading figure in criminal procedure law in New China." Do you have any observations about his academic studies and his conduct as a person? ;

;

;;Bian Jianlin:;;Teacher Chen is a recognized master and an important founder and leader of our discipline. people. I feel that my husband's biggest specialty in learning is to learn from the best of other schools, to be open to all rivers, and to be tolerant, so later on he suddenly surpassed other teachers of his generation and was beyond the reach of others; the second is to know people and make good use of them, and make full use of their talents. Every time he writes something or works on a project, he can always hand over the relevant content to the most suitable person; the third thing is to be able to pay attention to and accept new things, and constantly improve himself by guiding students. ;

;

; Are there any cancer patients being cured?

;

; However, supporters have "shouted unjust" on the Internet on the grounds that Hou Yuanxiang cured many cancer patients. However, the southern weekend reporter's investigation found that whether there was cancer patients was really cured by Hou Yuanxiang, it was a question.

;

; Another interviewee Wang Jingjiang is a village in Zibo, Shandong, and the patient is his mother -in -law.他说，侯元祥曾打算在该村建一座疗养院，自己当时给村支书开车，由此认识了侯。后来他岳母得了癌症，已经没有手术可能，做了一段时间化疗后，他就联系了“侯教授”，“那时候是有病乱投医”。

;

;王敬江表示，侯元祥的药“不错”，其岳母喝了感觉“有劲”了，不过后来由于受不了那个味道，就不再喝了。

;

;在中医药法起草论证专家之一、律师杨逢柱看来，侯元祥的“抗癌药”是几种中药混在一起，中药治疗虽然很少有“立竿见影”的，但也不是没有效果，“你补气的（中药）一上，肯定有效果”。

;

;而王敬江也强调：他岳母并不是“治好了”，而是“没（再）犯、没转移”。

;

;第三位受访者李诚（化名）是吉林延边人。他告诉南方周末记者，患者是他爷爷，确实曾找侯元祥看过病，吃过他的自制药。老人家已经于2022年9月去世。

;

;李诚说，爷爷是2019年7月确诊直肠癌，已经扩散到淋巴。亲戚向他介绍了侯元祥。他至今没见过侯元祥，两人主要通过微信联系。他说，加了微信后，侯元祥曾把个人简介发过来，“什么世界癌症、什么委员会、什么癌症治疗专家，我在百度上也搜了，确实能搜到这个人，当就觉得这个人挺sharp".

;

;在接到南方周末记者电话时，李诚仍称侯元祥为“侯教授”。在得知侯元祥并非教授，甚至连医师执业证也没有时，他很吃惊，表示如果当初知道这个情况，是否还找侯元祥看病“肯定要斟酌”。

;

;李诚说，爷爷除了喝侯元祥的抗癌药，还吃了侯元祥推荐的“营养餐”。 “吃了三个疗程左右，（爷爷）恢复得挺好。”李诚说，为此，他还给侯元祥介绍了不少病人。

;

;不过，李诚不能确认，他爷爷病情的一度好转，“究竟是侯教授的药起了更大作用，还是我爷爷个人的心态起了更大的作用”。李诚说，“我们都说（侯元祥的药）管用、好使，可能也对爷爷的精神状态起到了支撑作用。”

;

;杨逢柱曾参与过许多药品临床试验论证方面的工作.在他看来，病人在做治疗时，“心理作用很重要，能影响30%（治疗）效果”。

;

;李诚还表示，爷爷在吃侯元祥的药期间，也做了其他治疗包括动手术，“中西医同步发力”。

;

;假药“瘦身”之后

;

;无论是代理律师还是侯元祥本人，均未料到一审会判得如此重。

;

;不过，根据相关法律规定和司机机关查明的涉案金额，侯元祥的自制药一旦被认定为假药，就轻判不了。

;

;一审期间，侯家多名代理律师以侯元祥的自制药没有给病人造成伤害后果为由，进行无罪辩护或罪轻辩护。而侯元祥本人也提出，他的药“小孩都可以喝”。

;

;然而，没有造成伤害后果并不意味着侯元祥不构成“生产、销售假药罪”，也不意味着不可以被重判。

;

;根据2011年修订前的刑法，构成“生产、销售假药罪”，需要存在“严重危害人体健康”的情况，致人死亡或重伤，才能判十年以上有期徒刑。

;

;赵因表示，为了加大对假药的打击力度，2011年的刑法第八修正案对“生产、销售假药罪”作了修改，不再把“严重危害人体健康”作为入罪门槛，只要生产、销售假药就构成犯罪。

;

;与此同时，刑法第八修正案也不再以致人死亡、重伤作为重判的惟一条件，规定有“其他特别严重情节”的，也可以重判。 2014年，最高法、最高检出台司法解释，只要生产、销售假药达到50万元，就构成刑法第八修正案里的“其他特别严重情节”。

;

;而侯元祥生产、销售假药的金额，一审法院认定为1436万余元，远远超过了50万元。这意味着侯元祥的自制药一旦被认定为假药，就适用于要判十年以上有期徒刑。

;

;侯元祥的自制药能否认定为假药，要以药品管理法为依据。赵因认为，2019年该法修订之前，假药的认定相对简单——药品只要没有取得批号，就符合“以假药论处”，从而构成刑法意义上的假药。

;

;然而，2019年修订后的药品管理法对假药的定义作了重大修改，没有取得批号的药品不再当然以假药论处。

;

;业界普遍认为，药品管理法的上述修改与湖南陆勇案有关。白血病患者陆勇从非正规渠道购买仿制药，并帮病友代购此药。 2018年，以其为原型的电影《我不是药神》上映，引发舆论对中国药品管理制度的广泛讨论。

;

;修订后的药品管理法对假药“瘦身”，规定只有四种情况才能定为假药（详见文后资料链接）。

;

;据长期从事药品打假实践和研究的北京长江药学发展基金会理事曹国营介绍，药品管理法修订后，药监部门办理的假药案呈“断崖式下跌”。

;

;据国家药品监督管理局网站数据，2019年，全国由药监部门查处的假药案数量为14041起，而在药品管理法修订后的次年，此类案件的数量只有7361起，减少了近一半。

;

;南方周末记者以“假药”为关键词在裁判文书网搜索，发现以药品管理法修订为分界，假药刑事案件判决书数量从2019年的5044件骤降至2020年的2361件，少了一大半。此后几年也呈下降趋势。

;

;2019年版药品管理法在对假药“瘦身”的同时，大幅加大了罚款力度。 “罚款的起点是生产销售金额的15倍，不足10万的按10万算。”赵因说，“只要是生产、销售假药，起码要罚150万，罚也要罚死他（生产、销售假药者）。”

;

;中药材是药品吗？

;

;在曹国营看来，在目前药品打假整体环境下，青岛能查处侯元祥案“很不容易”。

;

;然而，侯元祥是否应以“生产、销售假药”罪被追究刑事责任，却在法律界和中医药界均引起争议。

;

;侯家代理律师以2019年修订后的药品管理法为由，认为侯元祥的自制药是以中药材为原料制成，不应认定为假药，侯元祥等不构成“生产、销售假药罪”。

;

;事实上，据侯元祥案一审判决书，公安机关最初是以“非法经营罪”对侯元祥等人立的案。

;

;立案一个月后，青岛市市监局出具假药认定书，对侯元祥的四种自制药认定为假药。根据2014年最高法、最高检出台的相关司法解释，对于“假药”“劣药”难以确定的，司法机关可以根据地市级以上药品监督管理部门出具的认定意见进行认定。

;

;据上述认定书，侯元祥自制的“抗癌1号”“抗癌2号”、声称治肝癌的“肝”和用来治疗心脏病的“野生心脑汤”四种药被认定为假药。

;

;案件进入审查起诉阶段后，应黄岛区人民检察院要求，青岛市市监局又专门出具了一份补充说明，对为何将涉案产品认定为假药进行了说明。

;

;说明中指出，侯元祥的四款自制产品“无药品注册证号、无医疗机构制剂备案、无药品生产许可证、无医疗机构制剂许可证、无国家标准等，却生产出宣传治疗癌症、肝癌、心脑血管疾病等的药品销售给病人治病，涉案产品属于非药品。大家一致认为，上述四种涉案产品符合新修订的药品法关于药品的定义……”

;

;一位二审代理律师指出，上述论述一方面说涉案产品“符合药品的定义”， 另一方面又说其属于“非药品”。在其看来，青岛市市监局之所以如此论述，是因为按新药品管理法，“惟一能卡上的就是这一条（非药品冒充药品）”。

;

;对于侯元祥自制药的假药认定问题，南方周末记者联系青岛市市监局，该局以侯元祥案件正在审理为由拒绝采访。

;

;一审期间，侯家几乎所有代理律师均对该案的假药认定提出质疑。其中一位律师指出，“抗癌1号”“抗癌2号”所使用的药材，大部分均在2020 版《中国药典》一部中，并不符合“以非药品冒充药品”。

;

;不过，在赵因看来，中药材并不当然算作药品——中药材仅是制作药品的原料，可以在药材市场销售，但是药品必须拥有药品经营许可证才可以Sale.

;

;而侯元祥父女的自制药所用的药材究竟购自哪里？一审判决书所引用的相关供述中并无交代，而侯静也不能提供购进的票据和合法证明文件。据侯静前夫付松杰供述，侯静购买的草药都是通过快递、物流发过来的，收货人一般都是用假名。

;

;二审代理律师李刚以涉案假药的认定未经过省级药监部门检验为由，对一审判决所依据的假药认定书提出质疑。

;

;根据最高法、最高检2022年新出台的司法解释（生效后2014年旧司法解释即废止），对于“非药品冒充药品”这一情况，只有在不存在争议的情况下，市级药监部门才可以直接认定为假药。对于存在争议的，则需经过省级以上药品监督管理部门设置或者确定的药品检验机构进行检验。

;

;在李刚看来，侯元祥案涉案假药的认定显然存在争议，理应进行检验。不过他认为，民间中药偏方缺乏国家标准，即使检验其结果也缺乏科学性、合法性。且侯元祥的药当时没检验，现在扣押已超过一年，“早都变质了，怎么检验？”

;

;2023年11月5日，侯元祥另一位代理律师告诉南方周末记者，案件发回重审之后，检察机关向法院补充了不少证据，其中包括一份对侯元祥自制药的检验报告。根据这份检验报告，侯元祥的自制药里检出了用以治疗糖尿病的西药成分，青岛市市监局凭此仍认定涉案产品为假药。

;

;侯元祥上述代理律师表示，这表明药监部门可能不再按“非药品冒充药品”认定涉案产品为假药。

;

;对于侯元祥所涉罪名，广东法全律师事务所律师杨志伟向南方周末记者提出另一种观点：如果侯元祥的“抗癌1号”“抗癌2号”明确与治疗癌症“不搭界”，侯元祥完全是以卖药赚钱为目的，那么他有可能构成诈骗罪。

;

;南方周末记者在裁判文书网上查到这样一个案例：2019年，没有行医资质的李某祥，因生产、销售假药罪被抓，但检察院以诈骗罪将其逮捕和起诉，法院以诈骗罪对其判处有期徒刑14年。

;

;侯元祥是否可能涉嫌诈骗罪？ A reporter from the Southern Weekend asked about a first -instance lawyer of Hou Yuanxiang. After a few seconds of silence, the lawyer asked: Scam? Isn't that heavier?随后，他表示侯元祥“不大可能”构成诈骗罪。

;

;侯元祥的另一位一审代理律师认为侯元祥构成“妨害药品管理罪”。该罪名是2020年出台的刑法第十一修正案新设立的，它指向生产、销售没有取得批号却未被认定为假药的药品的犯罪行为，该罪名比“生产、销售假药罪”要light.

;

;这位律师未接受南方周末记者采访，但说了这样一句话：“如果说判他（侯元祥）家无罪，那咱们都可以以中医的名义去做中医的任何事情。”

;侯元祥被调查期间，网上出现自媒体为其“喊冤”的大量视频。农健插画

;

;侯元祥的一位二审代理律师向南方周末记者坦言，对一审被重判的侯元祥来说，二审是“背水一战”。而该案二审能发回重审，“媒体起了很大的作用”。 （侯元祥案报道详见;《冒充专家行医十年，靠秘方自制抗癌药：无证“神医”的罪与罚》;）

;

;该律师所说的媒体指的是网络自媒体。 In fact, the media reports of the mainstream institutions reported Hou Yuanxiang's fake medicine cases after the second instance ruling was returned to retrial.

;

;在自媒体助力下，本来名不见经传的侯元祥，被描述为一位被冤判的“治癌神医”。

;

;“有公安背景的女子”

;

;2023年3月中旬，侯元祥假药案一审判决一个多月后，一篇题为《九岁鑫鑫求助：妈妈救治三千多癌症患者却被判刑十一年，罚款三千万》的文章开始在网上传播。该文称，侯元祥女儿侯静用中药祖传秘方治好了很多疑难杂症，但其所配制的中药液被青岛市监局“毫无依据”地定为假药，侯静一审判刑11年，全家牵连。文中还附上了侯静9岁儿子对外求助的照片：“妈妈您治病救人何罪之有啊？让全国网友替你评论吧……”

;

;此文引发网友热议。 The reporter from the Southern Weekend noticed that this article emphasized that Hou Jing graduated from the University of Traditional Chinese Medicine and was a Chinese medicine division, but he could not mention Hou Jing without a physician's practice certificate.

;

;侯元祥儿媳李建英告诉南方周末记者，一审判决后，侯元祥想利用网络“喊冤”，当时曾要她家孩子的照片，她担心孩子会受影响，就没给。后来才用了侯静儿子的照片。

;

;2023年6月底，自媒体人吴鹏飞开始介入侯元祥假药案。 Wu Pengfei claims to be "old journalists" and "well -known online writers". They have an account number on platforms such as Douyin, Kuaishou, and today's headlines. A reporter in the Southern Weekend found that Wu Pengfei worked in a media in Hubei Province in his early years and set up a planning marketing company after leaving the media.在开始介入侯元祥假药案时，吴鹏飞就曝出一个大新闻：一位有公安背景的女士曾开价一千万，要买侯元祥的治疗秘方，遭到拒绝后曾威胁说，要让侯元祥一家人等着坐牢。

;

;有多个自媒体博主引用了吴鹏飞上述说法，以至于“有公安背景的女子强买药方不成举报侯元祥”一说，成为侯元祥假药案的主流网络舆论。

;

;不过，侯元祥的二审代理律师李刚向南方周末记者表示，他虽然听侯元祥说过此事，但并没有看到相关证据，侯元祥也没向司法机关提出有人敲诈勒索他的控告。作为律师，他对这个说法“不予置评”。

;

;侯元祥的一审代理律师杨子宁也告诉南方周末记者，上述说法“在（案）卷里体现不出来”。

;

;南方周末记者注意到，2020年新冠疫情时，吴鹏飞曾力捧过另一位“神医”——宣称注射苯酚能治好新冠的无证医生李跃华，还发布消息称李跃华受韩国邀请前往抗疫，但该消息被韩国官方否认，李跃华本人也对媒体表示他不知道此事。

;

;南方周末记者试图联系吴鹏飞，但截至发稿，对方未回复。

;

;“民间调查可靠性有多大？”

;

;在发出上述文章之后，吴鹏飞又在多个平台上连续发布题为《民间中医冤案》的短视频，如今已经播到第100集，其中仅抖音平台一家的播放量就已超过1600万。在这些短视频中，吴鹏飞称侯元祥为“侯老”，说他是“中医治癌第一人”，有“独门医术”和“惊世疗效”，“堪称一位国宝”，“身上的每根汗毛都是金子”。

;

;此外，吴鹏飞还引用了一组数据，以表明侯元祥是“治癌神医”。他说，“一家全国性民间中医组织”对中国十大治癌名老中医的疗效进行了调查：“第一名就是侯元祥，当时确认他治好的癌症患者是1166人，第二名老中医确认治好的仅有11人。”

;

;李建英也向南方周末记者表示，侯元祥“治好了”1166个癌症病人。 “他（侯元祥）都有记录的。”她说。

;

;不过，吴鹏飞没有说“全国性民间中医组织”究竟是哪家机构。事实上，就连李刚也对吴鹏飞所说的数据持有疑问：“民间调查可靠性有多大？”

;

;在另一个短视频里，吴鹏飞说侯元祥治愈了三千多名癌症patient.而在“央地健康”网（一个声称为“民间医师”提供交流、展示、推广服务的网站）的个人介绍里，侯元祥则是“治愈两万多癌症”。

;

;也有自媒体对侯元祥提出质疑，不过点击量与吴鹏飞的短视频不可同日而语。自媒体“中医陈雷”发过一个视频，称侯元祥是一个“制售假药的骗子”，呼吁公众冷静看待此案：“如果置事实于不顾，不是爱中医，是在害中医。”

;

;视频发布后，“中医陈雷”即遭到侯元祥众多支持者的网络围攻，吴鹏飞更是连续发布8个短视频反驳。没过多久，“中医陈雷”那条视频就下架了。

;

;在网上看到侯元祥假药案后，南京圭石堂中医馆总经理钱辉决定出手声援。钱辉曾有过与侯元祥类似的经历。据媒体报道，钱辉没有医师执业证，为了规避“非法行医”，他的中医馆聘请正规医生给病人开方子，钱辉则会在一旁“指导”， 而医生开的药都是圭石堂根据自家“秘方”做的自制药。

;

;2017年底，圭石堂被人举报，由于未取得批号，其自制药被南京市药监局认定为假药，钱辉及圭石堂多名员工因涉嫌“生产、销售假药罪”，一度被警方刑事拘留，其中钱辉被关了28天。

;

;“我们为什么支持侯元祥无罪？主要原因是站在一个保护传统中医的角度，因为侯元祥的案子一旦是有罪判决，那么很多的传统中医就干不下去了。”钱辉对南方周末记者说。

;

;在圭石堂“合伙人”之一龚飞云看来，传统中医就是“民间中医”，而侯元祥是众多“民间中医”的一个。他对“民间中医”这样定义：体制外中医的统称，没有进大学接受过正规中医药学教育，没有医师执业证。

;

;2013年6月底，龚飞云曾赴青岛面见侯元祥。据龚飞云介绍，当时侯元祥虽已被警方“监视居住”，但当时管得还不严，他想办法将其约出来，并拍了视频。

;

;“民间中医大学”

;

;龚飞云当年也曾参与圭石堂假药案的斡旋。据他透露，在该案办理期间，圭石堂曾与南京警方打了一场“舆论战”：先是南京一家媒体站在警方立场曝光该案，之后龚飞云联系了一家外地媒体，发出了圭石堂方面the sound of.

;

;最终，该案停留在公安侦查阶段，没能进入检察院审查起诉环节。经此一劫的圭石堂，此后主打上海市场。

;

;在钱辉和龚飞云之前，另一位“民间中医”支持者管乐也在网上声援侯元祥。

;

;管乐自称是“民间中医大学首任校长”“长城铭刻人物”“世界中医堂联合会会长”。他将“民间中医大学”形容为民间中医的“黄埔军校”，不过，这所大学3年前就宣称要成立，但至今也没成立。管乐曾公开说，这所大学成立后，将评选“民间中医院士”“民间中医博士”“民间中医教授”。

;

;相关信息显示，2020年6月，成立“民间中医大学”的口号刚喊出，管乐就声称要开一个该大学某地分校的成立大会。而会议结束次日，管乐就在多个中医群发布了一个医疗培训班的广告，声称没有任何医学基础的人都可以当场学会，培训费为两天18000元（可优惠）。不料，此举连带“民间中医大学”，均遭到江苏一家三甲医院医生顾经宇的实名公开质疑，管乐回应说：“民间中医大学”是创新：“既然是创新，肯定就没有任何证，既然没证，那肯定就不合法……”

;

;去青岛见完侯元祥后，龚飞云与管乐曾在上海会面，两人还一同拜访了华东政法大学一位支持民间中医的教授，并请其就侯元祥案发声。

;

;2023年9月9日，管乐策划的第二届民间中医大学筹建预备会议在北京召开，曾为侯元祥案发声的钱辉、龚云飞、卫柏兴均参与了此次会议，会议期间专门讨论了侯元祥案。

;

;“（侯元祥案）等于把所有民间中医都团结起来了。”龚飞云对南方周末记者说。

;

;侯元祥假药案二审裁定发回重审后，侯元祥的支持者们一片欢腾，纷纷在网上发布“喜讯”，认为该案出现“重大转机”。

;

;此后不久，有自媒体又曝出一条新闻——侯元祥正在绝食，且消息“千真万确”。

;

;不过，吴鹏飞很快发短视频澄清，称侯元祥是由于身体虚弱吃不下饭，他的徒弟“因为害怕有人暗害侯老，故意对外发布绝食消息，以便引起全社会的关注".

;

;数日后，吴鹏飞再发短视频，称“侯老”身体恢复，开始每顿“喝一点小酒”，而看管他的警员一天三顿都只能煮面条吃……

;

;据二审律师李刚透露，二审发回重审后，因为“知道（侯元祥原监视居住地）的人太多”，警方给侯元祥换了一个地方执行监视居住。

;

;“我不再参与这个事情了”

;

;李诚（化名）是侯元祥一名吉林籍癌症患者的孙子，他自称在许多事情“都不知道”的情况下，也曾参与过为侯元祥“喊冤”的舆论战。

;

;2022年6月8日，侯元祥提起上诉后，一个微信名叫“流星与晚霞”的人加了李诚的微信，自称是“侯教授”的儿媳妇。

;

;“到时候您可以写联名信给侯教授求个情吗？”

;

;“侯教授怎么了？”

;

;“被别人举报了，现在在医院治疗，还吃不上自己的药。”

;

;李诚这才知道侯元祥出事，他告诉“流星与晚霞”，自己可以帮侯元祥写联名信。

;

;两个月后，“流星与晚霞”把李诚拉进了一个支持侯元祥的癌症患者微信群。

;

;李诚手机里存着一个标注为“李主任抗癌”的号码，这个号码是侯元祥给他的。他为爷爷买药，就是与这位“李主任”联系。

;

;在接到南方周末记者打来的电话之前，李诚一直以为，“李主任”叫“李建英”，是侯元祥所在医院药品方面的负责人。

;

;但实际上，“李主任”是侯元祥的儿子侯雷，“流星与晚霞”才是李建英，她也是侯家所有成年人当中惟一未涉案的一个。

;

;据一审判决书，在侯元祥案中，侯元祥对外称“侯教授”，负责提供配方、诊疗癌症疾病、销售药品，女儿侯静负责诊疗癌症以外的疾病和销售药品、购进中草药、熬制中药药剂等，儿子侯雷则在后台冒充负责拿药、退药的医生“李主任”，也就是李建英。

;

;加了“流星与晚霞”微信一个多月后，李诚与侯元祥也联系上了。 “他（侯元祥）说把我的信息放到网上去，我说行，只要对你那边的案情有帮助。”李诚说。

;

;李诚还建议侯元祥在自媒体平台讲一下这个事情，以提高关注度，“他说行，我让家里边去弄一下”。

;

;后来，侯元祥给李诚发了一些案件材料，让他帮忙联系媒体。此后就没了音讯。而李诚也没能帮侯元祥联系到媒体。一直到2023年7月下旬，他给侯元祥发信息，“他给我回了一句，说（二审）快开庭了，问题不大”。这是李诚最后一次与侯元祥联系。在此之前，侯家提出，把李诚的个人信息放到网上，作为侯元祥“治愈”癌症患者的案例之一，他同意了。然而，名单还没发到网上，李诚的爷爷就去世了。

;

;在得知真相后，李诚意识到事情“没那么简单”——“这些我都不知情，我根本就不知道。我只是作为一个病人家属，想着如果能帮忙的话就帮一下，但是前提必须要在法律的框架内……我不再参与这个事情了。”

;

;Same-sex sexual behavior cannot directly produce offspring, and has long been regarded as a paradox of Darwinian evolution. . Because according to general understanding, in nature where natural selection and survival of the fittest occur, same-sex sexual behavior consumes precious energy and time but fails to produce offspring. Such behavior should have been eliminated in evolution, but the reality is that same-sex sexual behavior is still in the process of evolution. There is no shortage of them in nature and human society.

;

;Scientists have discovered same-sex behavior in more than 1,500 species of animals. Such behavior is not affected by gender and can occur between two males or two females. It appears in artificial breeding environments and also in the wild. It is not an accidental behavior forced by extreme environments. This also poses a difficult problem for scientists to understand its evolutionary logic.

;

;In October 2023, researchers from the University of Granada in Spain and other institutions tried to verify some relevant explanatory hypotheses through germline analysis of a large number of mammal same-sex sexual behavior information. Their latest research, published in Nature Communications, suggests that the evolution of same-sex sexual behavior is likely an adaptation to nature.

;

;Maintaining same-sex social relationships

;

;“Same-sex sexual behavior occurs in many mammalian species, including our relatives the great apes. Rather than classifying it as maladaptive or abnormal behavior, our study shows that this sexual behavior in mammals is a convergent adaptation that helps maintain social relationships and reduce same-sex conflicts." Lead author of the latest study, while at the Spanish Arid Zone Experimental Station Function and Evolution José M. Gómez, a professor at the Department of Ecology and the University of Granada, told Southern Weekend reporters that although same-sex sexual behavior occurs in many species, it is especially common among primates. This may Precisely because primates are more social than many other groups of mammals.

;

;From a data point of view, research has found same-sex sexual behavior in more than 260 species of mammals. In more than 80% of the cases, it takes the form of back crawling or genital contact, and less than 30% Some species even display same-sex behavior through courtship or pairing. Judging from the age, same-sex sexual behavior mainly occurs in adult mammals, and young same-sex sexual behavior is only found in 10 species of animals. From an environmental perspective, more than 80% of the samples had same-sex sexual behavior occurring in wild or semi-wild environments. In terms of gender, same-sex behavior is relatively evenly distributed among mammals. Female same-sex behavior has been recorded in more than 160 species, and male same-sex behavior has been found in more than 190 species. Combined, about half of all species have same-sex behavior. Homosexuality involving two genders at the same time.

;

;It is worth noting that the latest study is only based on existing records of same-sex sexual behavior in mammals and does not represent the entire situation of mammals. In fact, because the discovery of same-sex sexual behavior in nature relies on observation, and in some species females and males look very similar, and it is even difficult to distinguish between male and female. Some scientists estimate that the current records of same-sex sexual behavior in nature should be underestimated. Moreover, compared with mammals, birds, reptiles, fish, insects and other invertebrates are either small in size or live far away from the ground, making observation difficult, but they have all recorded same-sex sexual behavior. Therefore, patterns of same-sex sexual behavior in nature are far more complex than what has been observed in mammals.

;

;Previously, many hypotheses interpreted same-sex sexual behavior as maladaptive or abnormal behavior, speculating that this behavior may be a manifestation of specific conditions such as incorrect gender identity, lack of opposite-sex peers, or frustration with opposite-sex sexual behavior. From the perspective of sexual behavior scenarios, the latest research has found that same-sex sexual behavior does not necessarily require extremely special occasions. Although same-sex sexual behavior is rare in some species and can only be observed in very special circumstances, for about 40% of the mammals studied, same-sex sexual behavior can be regarded as moderate to high frequency activity during a specific period of time, and during mating Seasons are easy to observe.

;

;Same-sex and opposite-sex coexist

;

;And some behavioral observations have long shown that same-sex sexual behavior may play a positive role in some populations. For example, some same-sex behavior among male bottlenose dolphins may help strengthen alliances among small groups, and same-sex behavior among female bonobo groups may promote reconciliation among members. However, the latest study's germline analysis does not focus on the mechanisms of same-sex sexual behavior in specific species, but uses large-scale statistics to link same-sex sexual behavior to social behavior. This research shows that same-sex sexual behavior is similar to many other behavioral traits that have evolved through natural selection.

;

;Professor Jose Gomez reminded that the meaning of same-sex sexual behavior here should be understood within the framework of evolutionary biology, which is still different from the current human society’s views on gender and other related issues. Because in the study of evolutionary biology, same-sex sexual behavior is a temporary behavior of individuals in a certain period of time, not a permanent behavior or life choice. They may also have heterosexual sexual behavior at the same time. Therefore, it cannot be directly related to human society. behavior analogy.

;

;In human society, issues related to same-sex sexual behavior are rooted in different cultural environments and historical traditions in different places, and are more complicated to understand. But in recent years, the discussion of distinguishing human same-sex sexual behavior has also attracted the attention of scientists. The core concern is to what extent people who have had same-sex sexual behavior can be defined as homosexual.

;

;In 2019, researchers from Harvard University and other institutions published a large-scale genetic study in Science magazine, trying to reveal the genetic characteristics of same-sex sexual behavior, which is the so-called "homosexuality" Gene". Through collaboration with the British Biobank and genetic testing analysis company 23andMe, researchers finally identified multiple genetic loci related to same-sex sexual behavior from hundreds of thousands of genetic samples, indicating that the "gay gene" is similar to other behavioral traits. It is also polygenic.

;

;But in 2021, scientists from sex and gender research institutions such as Indiana University’s Kinsey Institute publicly expressed opposition to this research, believing that it only distinguishes people by whether they have had same-sex sexual intercourse. It conflates heterosexuality, bisexuality and homosexuality, and does not accurately measure people's sexual behavior, sexual attraction and sexual identity. Therefore, the genetic characteristics ultimately discovered may not reveal the tendency to have same-sex sexual behavior, but only reveal the likes. The personality trait of pursuing novelty.

;

;Because in the view of sexology researchers, heterosexuality should be a continuous pattern of sexual attraction. Just because a person has had same-sex sexual behavior does not mean that he is not heterosexual. Alfred Kinsey, the pioneer of sexology research, developed a scale very early to distinguish people who have had same-sex sexual behavior. According to the frequency of same-sex sexual behavior, people can be divided into multiple types, rather than Either gay or straight.

;

;It may help reproduction

;

;The controversy in human society about how to distinguish same-sex sexual behavior from homosexuality also reflects a difficulty in understanding the logic of evolution to a certain extent. Compared with human society, which highly binds concepts such as "same-sex sexual behavior", "homosexuality" and "no offspring", same-sex sexual behavior may never mean "no offspring" in the long evolutionary history.

;

;"Darwin's paradox of evolution should be put aside; it no longer exists because the existence of bisexual behavior in various animal species ensures that same-sex behavior does not hinder reproductive success." Empire Vincent Savolainen, a professor at the Department of Life Sciences at the Polytechnic Institute of Technology, told Southern Weekend reporters that there are many concepts surrounding same-sex sexual behavior, but from a biological perspective, same-sex sexual behavior may be the same as homosexuality, bisexuality, etc. There are some similar mechanisms and evolutionary logic, which biologists can continue to study in the future. At the same time, psychologists can also delve into other aspects of this complex behavior, such as sexual preferences, to better understand the evolution of same-sex behavior.

;

;From a historical perspective on same-sex sexual behavior, the key reason why evolutionary logic is difficult to understand lies in the inference that its adaptation costs are too high and the cost of behavior is too high. However, including the latest research, many studies in recent years have shown that same-sex sexual behavior does not mean "no offspring" in the evolutionary process, but may have a positive impact on the reproduction of offspring in other indirect ways.

;

;In 2021, Brendan Zietsch, a scientist at the Center for Psychology and Evolution at the University of Queensland in Australia, used genetic data from hundreds of thousands of samples to simulate human evolution, which also included a large number of heterosexual Partner data. The analysis shows that among people who only have heterosexual sex, genetic genes related to same-sex sexual behavior can allow people to have more opposite-sex sexual partners at the same time, which means that they have gained a sexual mating advantage.

;

;Further analysis shows that this is also related to the personality traits of openness and risk-taking. People who are more open-minded will be more willing to try new things and have greater curiosity and imagination. Researchers speculate that genes related to same-sex behavior not only endow people with same-sex sexual tendencies, but also give people relevant personality traits, which gives people with relevant genetic genes an advantage in finding opposite-sex partners.

;

;Thus, although same-sex sexual behavior itself does not produce offspring, related genes can give people the advantage of having offspring, resulting in same-sex sexual behavior being preserved to this day in the long evolution. However, Brendan Zic emphasized to Southern Weekend reporters that although this study has data advantages, the relevant explanations are still exploratory, and more research is needed to gain an in-depth understanding of the manifestations related to same-sex sexual behavior in order to understand the basis of its evolution.

;

;Heritability in primates

;

;Professor Vincent Savolainen has also conducted research on same-sex sexual behavior and reached similar conclusions supporting reproductive advantages. . In August 2023, through the analysis of three years of detailed observation data of rhesus monkeys, they found that same-sex sexual behavior is very common in the rhesus monkey community and is basically not affected by factors such as age or community structure, and it does not bring any consequences to them. What fitness costs, conversely, same-sex sexual behavior regulates peer relationships and increases reproductive success.

;

;Relevant research was published in Nature Ecology & Evolution, observing the social and sexual behavior of more than two hundred male rhesus monkeys. Combining ancestry data from decades ago, the study shows that same-sex behavior in male rhesus monkeys is both repeatable and heritable, with a heritability rate of 6.4%. This provides the first evidence of same-sex behavior in primates outside of humans. The first evidence that behavior is heritable.

;

;"Rhesus macaques share more than 70% of their DNA with humans and have a common ancestor with us dating back about 25 million years. They are the main non-human primates used in biomedical research Animals are also excellent models for studying behavioral ecological issues such as same-sex sexual behavior. However, it is worth noting that there are still differences between rhesus monkeys and humans. Through research, we hope to unravel these intricate mysteries and discover the underlying Common behavior in our evolutionary history." Professor Vincent Savolainen explained to Southern Weekend reporters that the latest research shows that same-sex sexual behavior may be a common feature of primate reproductive ecology, which is important for understanding the behavior of human groups. Same-sex sexual behavior has certain enlightenment, but due to the influence of some unique social factors in human society, same-sex sexual behavior in human society does have a high cost.

;

;"Humans appear to be the only species that exhibits strict homosexuality." Professor Vincent Savolainen said cultural factors can influence this phenomenon. For example, in Samoa, some gay men, although they have no offspring, actually assume the role of women in society and help raise the children of relatives. "I hope our research can play a role in fostering a more inclusive culture that embraces gender diversity, both in nature and in human society."

;"Lawyers and brokers" appear in many lawsuits related to contract disputes. (Photo provided by People’s Vision)

;

;On November 14, 2023, a recommendation letter issued by the Liaoning Provincial Brokers Association was circulated in the legal community. The letter showed that the association recommended a "lawyer broker" to the Haicheng City People's Court as a litigation agent in a loan dispute case.

;

;After the letters of recommendation were made public, many lawyers posted on social media to express concerns that lawyer brokers might corrupt the industry.

;

;"Lawyer broker" is not the first time that "lawyer broker" has appeared. With this keyword, 27 civil and enforcement cases can be retrieved on the Judgment Document Network. Among them, 24 cases in which lawyers and brokers acted as litigation agents were heard by courts at all levels in Liaoning Province.

;

;It is certain that lawyer brokerage should be a job type "created" by the Liaoning Provincial Brokers Association. The association recommends others as litigation attorneys in the name of social groups. However, relevant legal persons pointed out that the operations of the Liaoning Provincial Brokers Association violated relevant legal regulations, and there are no occupations related to "lawyer brokerage" in the national professional qualification catalog.

;

;After this matter was fermented in the legal community, the local lawyers association issued a reminder: Lawyers discovered the problem of "lawyer agents" and "legal agents" when performing their duties. You should raise objections to the case-handling agency where you are located, and do not participate in the operations of relevant companies or institutions.

;

;;For each case represented, 500 yuan is required to be paid to the association;

;

;In past cases, "lawyer brokers" mainly appeared in insurance disputes, contract disputes, and private lending disputes.

;

;In a motor vehicle traffic accident liability dispute ruled by the Yuhong District People's Court of Shenyang City in March 2023, Xiao drove a passenger car and rode an electric bicycle and ran a red light. Yang Mou collided, causing Yang to be injured. Yang then sued Xiao and the two insurance companies that Xiao insured, demanding various compensations totaling about 250,000 yuan. Both of Yang's litigation attorneys are "lawyers and agents." In the end, the Shenyang Yuhong District Court ordered the insurance company to pay compensation of about 120,000 yuan.

;

;In a contract dispute with the case number (2022) Liao 14 Min Zhong No. 1093, Yang and Liu signed a tableware factory transfer agreement, stipulating that Yang A certain person paid the transfer fee of RMB 170,000 in installments, but after the first payment period expired, Yang did not pay as agreed. Liu then sued Yang to demand performance of the contract and payment of liquidated damages, totaling approximately 200,000 yuan. Yang lost the case and appealed to the Huludao Intermediate People's Court, entrusting a "lawyer agent" to serve as his litigation agent. The Huludao Intermediate People's Court did not support Yang's appeal, and the second instance upheld the original verdict.

;

;The similarity between these cases is that the "lawyers and brokers" who represent the cases come from the same social organization: the Lawyers and Brokers Special Committee of the Liaoning Brokers Association.

;

;The National Social Organization Credit Information Disclosure Platform shows that the Liaoning Provincial Broker Association was registered and established in 2007. Its supervisory unit is the Liaoning Provincial Supply and Marketing Cooperative Federation, and its business scope In order to guide the work of the brokerage industry in the province, organize broker business training and provide legal, policy, information consulting services, etc. to brokers.

;

;The Special Committee for Lawyers and Brokers is a subsidiary organization of the Liaoning Provincial Broker Association. The association stated in the "Instructions for the Liaoning Provincial Broker Qualification Certificate" that, Possessing the Liaoning Provincial Broker Qualification Certificate can solve the problem of agency litigation qualification: you only need to pay 3,860 yuan once, and you can obtain the certificate after training and examination. "You can pass the test without a legal basis." After that, you can act as an agent in civil litigation in Liaoning Province. cases, and engage in related activities such as appearing in court to respond to lawsuits.

;

;In addition, those who have obtained the broker qualification certificate need to pay 500 yuan to the association to issue a recommendation letter for each case they represent. In addition, the broker's qualification certificate needs to be inspected every year, and the fee is 50 yuan.

;

;;Obviously different from citizen agents;

;

;Lawyer broker The events have once again put citizen agency in the spotlight. However, attorney-broker representation cases initiated by the Liaoning Provincial Brokers Association are significantly different from normal citizen representation.

;

;Before the amendment of the Civil Procedure Law in 2012, the law allowed three categories of citizens to represent civil litigation cases: close relatives of the parties, relevant social groups or employees of the unit where they work. persons; other citizens entrusted by the parties concerned and approved by the People's Court.

;

;Wu Zhiwei, deputy director of the Supreme People's Court Applied Law Research Base of Southwest University of Political Science and Law, said that the quality of citizen agency services is poor, fees are irregular, and it is easy to breed judicial rent-seeking, Regarding issues such as bribing judges, when the Civil Procedure Law was revised in 2012, "other citizens permitted by the court" were deleted, and the scope of citizens as entrusted litigation agents was limited to two categories: close relatives or staff of the parties; communities where the parties are located, Citizens recommended by units and relevant social groups.

;

;Further requirements for community recommendation can be found in the interpretation of the Supreme People's Court on the application of the Civil Procedure Law.

;

;It stipulates that if relevant social groups recommend citizens to serve as litigation agents, the groups should be non-profit legal persons registered and established in accordance with the law. The principal shall be a member of a social group, or the domicile of one of the parties shall be in the area of ​​activity of the social group. In addition, the recommended person should also be the person in charge of the society or a staff member who has a labor relationship with the society.

;

;Compared with relevant regulations, Wu Zhiwei believes that strictly speaking, the behavior of the Liaoning Provincial Brokers Association violates the provisions of Article 87 of the Judicial Interpretation, "These people do not Qualified to act as an agent in legal matters." The agency affairs must fall within the business scope specified in the articles of association of the social group. The business scope of the broker association is generally related to brokers. However, judging from the currently public judgment documents, the client in the case is not Brokers, "If brokers have relevant civil disputes, they act as litigation agents, which is in compliance with the regulations."

;

;Another question is whether social groups can provide paid services.

;

;As early as 1993, the Ministry of Justice issued the "Reply on Individual Citizens Not to Engage in Paid Legal Services Without Approval" which explicitly required that citizen agents No remuneration can be collected. According to relevant regulations, travel expenses in citizen representation can be reimbursed by the parties.

;

;But lawyers and brokers obviously charge fees. On November 14, 2023, the verdict of a contract dispute in Liaoning Province was circulated in the lawyer community: a lawyer and agent was sued by the client for failing to perform his obligation to appear in court in a previous divorce lawsuit, and requested the return of 5,000 yuan in legal services. fee.

;

;The "Tips for Social Organizations to Carry out Legal Service Activities" issued by the Social Organization Administration Bureau of the Liaoning Provincial Department of Civil Affairs on March 22, 2023 has mentioned that individual Social organizations illegally recommend citizens to act as agents in lawsuits and seek unfair economic benefits.

;

;This reminder sheet mentions that in accordance with relevant regulations, law-related social organizations strictly implement a management system with dual responsibilities between the registration management agency and the business supervisory unit. Social organizations shall carry out activities in accordance with the purposes and business scope stipulated in their articles of association and shall not engage in for-profit business activities.

;

;;Not in the National Vocational Qualification Catalog;

;

;Although Liaoning Province The Brokers Association has issued lawyer broker qualification certificates to many people, but the profession of "lawyer broker" is not included in the "National Vocational Qualification Catalog" announced by the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security in 2021. The professional qualifications stipulated in this catalog all specify the implementing departments or units, and require that no other institution or unit can set up professional qualifications for implementation on its own.

;

;On November 15, 2023, a reporter from Southern Weekend called Chen Wencheng, president of the Liaoning Provincial Broker Association, on related issues. He first stated that he could only undertake work in Liaoning Province. However, he later stated that he currently does not directly engage in civil litigation, nor does he engage in lawyer-broker-related business. As of press time, the association’s official website is no longer displayed properly.

;

;On November 16, Southern Weekend reporters called the Liaoning Provincial Department of Justice several times. The operator said they did not know anything about "lawyers and brokers" and that they could consult the local authorities for specific information. Lawyers Association. Southern Weekend reporters called the Liaoning Provincial Lawyers Association several times but received no reply as of press time.

;

;According to upstream news reports, relevant staff of the Liaoning Provincial Department of Civil Affairs responded that they would investigate the situation related to the Liaoning Provincial Brokers Association.

;

;On November 15, 2023, the Beijing Tongzhou District Lawyers Association issued a reminder that if lawyers discover problems with "lawyer agents" and "legal agents" when performing their duties, , you should raise objections to the case-handling agency where you are located, and do not participate in the operations of "legal brokers", "lawyer brokers" and other related companies and institutions.

;

;In Liaoning Province, Fushun Civil Affairs Bureau, Tieling Civil Affairs Bureau and other agencies have issued similar reminders.

;Since 2003, I have been shooting the "Inheritance" series 20 years, a total of 148 works. I moved a family's belongings stored in different spaces into the same space and posed for photos with their owners, most of which were taken outdoors with the home as the backdrop.

;

;90% of my past works were shot in China. It was a period of rapid economic development and modernization and globalization in China. I used this special Recorded by posing, the real internal space is briefly exposed in the external space, combined with the changes in the current environment, urban expansion, technological development, and changes in people's lifestyles, to create a dynamic social picture with static documentary .

;

;In 2022, I started photographing American families. Home is the smallest unit that makes up society, and many such units make up the entire society. I continue to use the "Household Possessions" series to reflect the internal structure and diversity of contemporary American society. I have observed that the basic material living standards of American families, regardless of urban or rural areas, are not much different, so I pay more attention to showing their spiritual attributes. I spend a long time preparing for each photo, learning the characters’ stories in advance, visiting their rooms, thinking about the purpose of the shoot, and carefully selecting items for display. The choice of family covers both native Americans and immigrants who miss their hometown, as well as concepts about love, career, identity and gender, and the passage of time. The objects in each picture have been carefully arranged, using materials to reflect spiritual life. I moved these spiritual items in space and placed them in the same picture to visually enhance the common scenes. , highlighting the current living conditions, beliefs and emotional memories of this family or individual, and using a photo to outline a combination of reality and the spiritual world. Readers can directly think through the photos and their stories.

;

;Thank you so much to the families who were willing to face my camera, show off their possessions, and share their stories.

;

;;

;Whitney Jensen August 2022

;

;Whitney Jensen, 36 years old. She was a very cheerful and enthusiastic woman who was born and raised in Galesburg, Illinois, USA. She traveled to Iowa, fell in love and got married while traveling, and worked in the hospitality industry for many years. When the marriage ended and the coronavirus pandemic hit, she moved to Peoria, found work as a photographer, and was profiled in magazines while taking pictures in the park.

;

;She currently works as a salesperson in a BMW store. She also enjoys interior design and creates small art installations of her own. In addition to her job at the BMW store, she has other part-time jobs, including helping out at a non-profit organization and performing poetry readings every Thursday night at the Contemporary Arts Center.

;

;Many of Whitney's belongings come from family members, such as her grandma's antique box and her cousin's old sofa who was shot. She is full of affection for these items and is closely related to her. A friend who she grew up with gave her an owl necklace with her first month's salary, and she has been collecting all kinds of owls ever since. Her name Whitney itself means wise owl, which was the name given to her by her aunt. She was born during the era when singer Whitney Houston was most popular.

;

;;

;

;George, the Shoeshine Man February 2023

;

;George Manias, 92, celebrated his 76th working anniversary with friends, family and customers.

;

;He has worked for U.S. Presidents Gerald Ford, Ronald Reagan, George W. Bush, Bill Clinton, Barack Obama and Joe Biden, every Illinois governor since 1952, every Peoria mayor since 1957 and many celebrities, diplomats and businessmen have polished their shoes.

;

;In 1931, George was born in Peoria, Illinois, USA. His parents were Greek immigrants. When he was four, he returned to his parents' native island of Crete, which the Nazis had occupied. George was captured and forced to carry water for the Germans barefoot and starve. After World War II, George and his family returned to Peoria in 1946 penniless. At the age of 15, George began working as a shoeshine boy to earn money to help his family. Through hard work, George used the money he saved to buy a store named "George's Shoe Shine and Hat Shop."

;

;George won many honors and medals, and his decades of hard work were praised by visitors from around the world. George treated everyone equally, and treated shoes regardless of whether they were high or low. He rubbed shoe polish on the leather with his bare hands. As for other secrets, he thought it was too early to reveal them now. Every January 1st, George would write the year on a brick for good luck.

;

;Now he works four hours a day, five days a week, and his 86-year-old brother Manny accompanies him every day. He considers the chairs in this room to be his most important possession; it is a place where he meets people and unites the community. In addition to his shoe polishing tools, there are photos of him with six U.S. presidents and dignitaries. George never married.

;

;;

;

;Colleen Johnson June 2023

;

;Colleen, 58 years old, her husband passed away due to illness a few years ago and currently lives alone. She works as the director of development for a software, website design and networking company in downtown Peoria. She was often active in events commemorating historical events, particularly the abolitionist movement and the Civil War, and she spoke on behalf of racial equality.

;

;Colleen loves old furniture and heirloom items, some of which are Asian antiques from her grandmother's collection. She loved bringing nature into the house and collected art and decorations mostly related to plants and animals. Her decorations are often paired, with lotus, leaves, and bird elements recurring, and the green plants and flowers she raises are also often paired. She likes to keep and recall beautiful things. Among these souvenirs are the dolls handmade by her grandmother, the quilts made by her mother, and the shirts of her late husband.

;

;Colleen is a mother and grandmother in life. Her son and daughter-in-law live in another city 90 minutes away. Their daughter is 3 years old. There is also a son on the way. Colleen has an adorable Yorkshire terrier named Toto who enjoys the joy of a new life. Colleen enjoys walking and exercising by the river and participating in sailboat racing.

;

;She has just started a new relationship.

;

;;

;Prasanna Jeer April 2023

;

;Prasana Gill and his wife Lavanya are from Chennai, South India. After completing his education and working in India for several years, he came to India 13 years ago with many dreams and hopes. U.S.

;

;Prasana is an IT employee who works for Caterpillar. He dances every day after work. Dance carries his passion and dreams. He founded two dance schools in his spare time, teaching traditional Indian dance and Bollywood dance. In the past seven years, he has had more than 100 students. Prasanna and his students have become the centerpiece of major festivals in Peoria. As a mainstay, they also perform voluntarily for charity.

;

;Some of Prasanna’s dance items were brought from India, and some were handmade by them. Their daughters, Oviya and Iniya, learned to dance at an early age, and dance was an integral part of this Indian family's life.

;

;Prasana said that he has realized his dream in the United States and is grateful to the people who gave him the opportunity. He is willing to use his own strength to repay the community and use dance to People connect, share joy, share love.

;

;Alexander Martin is an artist, performer, educator, and community advocate. Born and raised in the Appalachian Mountains of West Virginia, she moved to Illinois about 9 years ago to pursue a graduate degree and has lived here ever since.

;

;She strives to exist authentically, powerfully and joyfully in this space, and her works give her such a platform. It also allows her to share personal narratives and stories of her community and celebrate their existence.

;

;Fashion and clothing play an important role in her life. From performance outfits to everyday wear, she dresses and embellishes with meaning, and it's important to her to have a variety of items to create her looks. It’s her way of expressing and living authentically every day. She truly believes that being an artist is not just about the work you create, but also about how you live your life.

He is a very representative student who was one of the top Chinese students to study abroad. He has been working for Caterpillar, a Fortune 500 company, and has lived in the United States for 31 years.

Chinese culture. She is a board member of Global Fest and the person in charge of the Chinese booth, and she also appeared in the Chinese Spring Festival Gala performances. Much of the furniture, home furnishings and decorations were brought over from China and stayed with them for many years.

;

;The calligraphy work "Home" they held in their hands was made with their parents when they got married. Each of them wrote one or two strokes with a brush to form This "home".

;Bert and Lisa Rabe (Burt Raabe & Lisa Raabe) April 2023

;

She holds a master's degree in art therapy from Illinois State University and has been involved in counseling for 15 years, as well as being a yoga teacher. In the United States, they love Chicago, Washington, D.C., and Myrtle Beach. They prefer taking trains to flying or driving. Many of the items in the photos are materials Lisa used for her artwork; there are also items from both homes and second-hand stores.

;Mae & Jonathan Wright June 2023

;

;Erica, 29, just completed her BA in Art Therapy at Millikin University in Decatur, IL, and will be attending Lesley University in Cambridge, MA Graduate programs in healing.

;She is also a circus juggler, visual artist, and performance artist. On stage she is known by the name Hexli. ;Neng Wang & Lucy Feng April 2023;

;Wang Neng and Feng Luxi are a pair of first-generation immigrants born in the 1980s from mainland China. I have been in the United States for more than ten years, and I have gone through many obstacles all the way, first studying and then working, and moving several times.

;

;The two met through church activities in different cities, fell in love and got married, and now live in the small town of Peoria, Illinois. People also accumulate some belongings of their own.

;Barbie experienced domestic violence, mental illness, drug and alcohol problems, and was hospitalized multiple times for suicidal ideation. ;

;Brandy Centi-Fislar, 31, from Clearfield, Pennsylvania, High School Class of 2010 After graduation, she enrolled at Lincoln College in Lincoln, Illinois, on swimming and soccer scholarships.  

;

;In 2012, she earned an associate degree in art and transferred to Illinois State University in Normal, IL to begin her art studies.
